oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Original artwork "The Battle of Shiloh" by Henry Lovie
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bistre wash and pencil on heavy paper, 17" x 24" image depicting 2nd day of action at Shiloh w/ Union troops counter-attacking past Shiloh chapel. The Prussian-born Lovie (b. 1829) was one of the outstanding artist-correspondents of the Civil War. Though Lovie was not actually present at this April 7, 1862 charge, he "visited every division, obtained guides, listened to all stories from all sides, and made upwards of 20 local sketches of positions and scenery."
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
